allReviews.title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Not Bad, but A Bit Laggy
allReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2025
allReviews.body: I am writing this as someone who doesn't own a cellphone in the usual sense. I owned the HP iPAQ long before "smart phones" where ever though of. Basically, that was a smartphone without the phone. To this day, that is the ONLY reason I own a cellphone - as a pocket computer. I do not activate them, nor do I use them as a phone, so I cannot comment on those aspects. I also disable/uninstall every single google/tracking app/"feature" so I cannot comment on those. I CAN discuss this as a computer, though.As a pocket computer, this is fine. It's not great, but that is only because it comes SO loaded with tracking and google-tied services, some of which cannot be disabled. The battery life seems pretty good. The screen is nice and large. I'd prefer it if it were a LITTLE bit wider, but... The camera is much better quality than my old phone.One thing I DO notice, though, is that there seems to be a lag, especially when processing animations. For instance, playing solitaire, there is a slight lag in clicking the deck and the cards turning over. The final animation, where the cards fly around after you win, glitches and lags a bit, there, too. I don't know if my disabling half the phone has anything to do with that, but I wouldn't think so. Speaking of solitaire... the narrow screen aspect makes that pretty hard to see. Unless you play a game that allows rotating the screen.. better put those peeper on!For the price, though, if all you want is a basic, get you by cellphone, especially of you just want to use it as a computer, you could do worse...

They watch movies, the screen is big and good enough quality to keep them busy when they need to relax and watch their screens before bedtime or while I make dinner! Really a great phone.

allReviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Amazing cheap phone for GPS mapping
allReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2025
allReviews.body: I like to use a dedicated device for offline maps when exploring National Forest and BLM land (with Gaia GPS).  In the past I've use old phones - they were soooo slow.  I debated about getting a cheap tablet but saw this somehow and decided to give it a try.I saw a review or two that said you could use the phone like a wifi device but nobody confirmed the GPS chip worked without activating cell service.  Well, I am confirming it does.  I did not activate cell service and the GPS chip works in my map apps when in airplane mode.It really is amazing that this phone is $50 normally, and $40 when on sale.  For a use like mine, it is an incredible value.  Heck, the case I use is $12 and over a quarter of the price of the phone itself!  So glad I found this instead of buying a renewed/refurbished flagship that was already outdated.

Just follow the step by step instructions on the phone package. It includes everything needed to activate . Awesome phone service too! Get it don't overthink it! Thank you!

allReviews.body: This android phone is very good for the price. The battery life, speed, and fingerprint reader are all very good quality. The phone is a nice and big with a 90hz display, and the phone is made out of metal, not plastic. I like that it allows you to add a SD card for extra storage. Although it is locked to Tracfone, if you get the 10 dollar plan for 2 months, you can reach out to them to unlock it! I really recommend this phone!

allReviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Works out to about $12 a month(+ tax maybe) if you buy a yearly plan.
allReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2025
allReviews.body: Easy setup and activation.I doubt that the camera is actually 50 megapixel, but it is a nice camera with a bright flash.Internet loads as fast as my desktop on both wifi and cellular...(I think I had to toggle a setting to make sure it checked for and used Wifi before using Cell Data...)Starts with like 72 apps preloaded, only had to remove about 7 data/powerhogs.This would have been a $10,000 computer in the 1990's.It is amazing what we have failed to accomplish with our advancements.Definitely amazing what we have accomplished too though.

allReviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    MP3 player
allReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2025
allReviews.body: Was going to purchase an MP3 player but instead got this for $40. It was great for that, comes with stereo which I was surprised. You usually only get one speaker on phones, even some iPhones only have one.The screen leaves a lot to be desired, bad colors, low res and not backlit enough. I'm just using it as a media player so it's not a deal breaker for me. If it was my everyday phone that would get annoying rather quickly.Since it's Android based I was able to use a cracked Spotify APK and Stremio to get all my music and video streaming needs for free. Couldn't do this on my regular iPhone....(This is the 4G model does not have 5G for those who need it, with wifi it's plenty fast for my streaming needs)Battery life has been good, going on 4 days with one single charge. Just been using it to listen to music and the occasional video.

allReviews.title:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Its ok but lacks processing power.
allReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2025
allReviews.body: Overall this phone has just been adequate but has some drawbacks. The overall build feels like a 40 dollar phone and doesn't compare top a flagship phone. It is almost entirely made of plastic. That said, it seems durable enough.The screen is clear and bright but I don't know what kind of glass they use but it doesn't seem to be super hard as there are lots of tiny scratches and swirling after only a couple weeks of use and I don't even carry in my pocket a ton.The biggest drawback is in processing speed and power. This phone struggles to keep up with games. It works. It's just choppy. I am replacing a 7 year old galaxy S8 with broken screens on the front and back that hasn't been updated in ages and that phone still outperforms this one.All in all, if its just for texting and normal phone tasks its probably just adequate. Just dont expect too much from it.

allReviews.title:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Problems with this phone
allReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2024
allReviews.body: This appears to be a good phone.  However, I am not receiving a pop-up notification when I receive a voicemail message.  The only way I can find out if I have a voice message is to dial *86.Also, this phone occasionally won't display/receive pictures/images.  I have to turn the phone OFF, then turn it back on for it to download/receive a picture which someone has sent me.  So I don't know that I have a pending picture if the sending party doesn't tell me they sent me a picture.I don't know if this is a problem with MY particular phone or if this is a problem with this particular Motorola style phone.I have contacted Tracfone technical support on several occasions and they have tried to fix these issues by doing an upgrade and having me turn the phone off and on.Nothing works permanently to fix these two issues.

So I hope this gets to you, if you try the same thing, but I'm not going to take any points off for that, just a learning momeent.

In the previous year, I bought and had trouble with two other makes in the $1000 range.  My main interest for buying such expensive phones was the advanced cameras, not just communication.  It turns out that this inexpensive phone has almost the same photo capabilities and other capabilities as the expensive devices. In all ways it has been serving me very well so far.Oct 21, 2024  After using this phone for some time to take photos, I have found, that even with the 50 MP lens, the picture quality is far from as good as for the expensive phones.

allReviews.title:
2.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Worked in only part of my wood balloon frame house
allReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2025
allReviews.body: Caution!  Amazon lumps together similar items in the review. If the exact model is not listed in the review, the reviews may not be for the particular item you want.Motorola has a new model every year, but always the same model name. With only two years support from date of manufacture, check carefully that you are not getting an obsolete model.  Demand to know the year of the model.As a WiFi device, it works fine and has one game loaded.  The phone service didn‚Äôt work inside my house so it is just a device for a game to me.Only worked in some parts of my home. Per customer support, YMMV depending on trees in the way.

allReviews.title:

    Great phone for $50 and it's SafeLink Comparable
allReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2024
allReviews.body: For just $50, this phone is an unbeatable value! With 4GB of RAM and 64GB of storage, it's a great device for the price. While it does come with some pre-installed bloatware, most of the unwanted apps can be easily deleted. Plus, you can use your SafeLink Wireless SIM card with this TracFone, which is a huge bonus. The sound quality is excellent, the cameras are decent, and the phone is surprisingly fast. If you don't mind using Google apps, you'll find a ton of pre-installed options. Overall, I highly recommend this phone - it's a great buy! If you're looking for a SafeLink-compatible device, this is the one to choose.

criticalReviews.title:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Its ok but lacks processing power.
criticalReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2025
criticalReviews.body: Overall this phone has just been adequate but has some drawbacks. The overall build feels like a 40 dollar phone and doesn't compare top a flagship phone. It is almost entirely made of plastic. That said, it seems durable enough.The screen is clear and bright but I don't know what kind of glass they use but it doesn't seem to be super hard as there are lots of tiny scratches and swirling after only a couple weeks of use and I don't even carry in my pocket a ton.The biggest drawback is in processing speed and power. This phone struggles to keep up with games. It works. It's just choppy. I am replacing a 7 year old galaxy S8 with broken screens on the front and back that hasn't been updated in ages and that phone still outperforms this one.All in all, if its just for texting and normal phone tasks its probably just adequate. Just dont expect too much from it.

Lots of tediousness, button repetition, (you have to press enter like 70 times for it to register and unlock), turns off if it ‚Äúthinks‚Äù you‚Äôre not looking at it lol, it randomly beeps occasionally for no apparent reason while on silent‚Ä¶but if you just want to send occasional texts and take calls it works(ish.) on the upside, I‚Äôve dropped it pretty badly multiple times and it is perfectly fine, so it‚Äôs durable lol

criticalReviews.title:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Problems with this phone
criticalReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2024
criticalReviews.body: This appears to be a good phone.  However, I am not receiving a pop-up notification when I receive a voicemail message.  The only way I can find out if I have a voice message is to dial *86.Also, this phone occasionally won't display/receive pictures/images.  I have to turn the phone OFF, then turn it back on for it to download/receive a picture which someone has sent me.  So I don't know that I have a pending picture if the sending party doesn't tell me they sent me a picture.I don't know if this is a problem with MY particular phone or if this is a problem with this particular Motorola style phone.I have contacted Tracfone technical support on several occasions and they have tried to fix these issues by doing an upgrade and having me turn the phone off and on.Nothing works permanently to fix these two issues.

criticalReviews.title:
2.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Worked in only part of my wood balloon frame house
criticalReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2025
criticalReviews.body: Caution!  Amazon lumps together similar items in the review. If the exact model is not listed in the review, the reviews may not be for the particular item you want.Motorola has a new model every year, but always the same model name. With only two years support from date of manufacture, check carefully that you are not getting an obsolete model.  Demand to know the year of the model.As a WiFi device, it works fine and has one game loaded.  The phone service didn‚Äôt work inside my house so it is just a device for a game to me.Only worked in some parts of my home. Per customer support, YMMV depending on trees in the way.

criticalReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2025
criticalReviews.body: If you are an Apple/iPhone user, avoid Tracfone/Motorola/Google/Android pre-pay cell phones. That way lies madness. If you are a Google/Android user, you might stand a chance. Struggle to get Tracfone to activate the phone. Struggle to add minutes. Appear to have it set up and working..... next day additional Google/Android hoops to try to jump through.... next day even more hoops... phone won't ring. They can call me, but I can't hear them.... Texting tested good, now doesn't work. I can call them, but it says they are not available, but adds the call to their Recents list. Basically, if you are an Apple/iPhone user (even with years of tech experience).... you are toast. Admittedly, the same may hold for Google/Android users who try Apple/iPhone.Got them a relatively inexpensive ATT Apple/iPhone12 prepay package that has worked well.

Highly highly recommend to not get this phone if you are looking for a good reliable phone. IT IS CHEAP FOR A REASON!!!!!! Solid example of getting what you pay for.

productDetails.productTitle: Tracfone | Motorola Moto g Play 2024 | Locked | 64GB | 5000mAh Battery | 50MP Quad Pixel Camera | 6.5-in. HD+ 90Hz Display | Sapphire Blue
featureBullets: 6.5" HD+ 90Hz Display with Corning Gorilla Glass 3. / Snapdragon 680 processor.
50MP sensor with Quad Pixel Photo Night Vision. / Dolby Atmos and Hi-Res Audio.
5,000mAh battery for up to 46 hours of battery life. / 64GB of storage + 1TB more with microSD card. / 4GB RAM, expandable up to 6GB with RAM Boost.

Carrier: This phone is locked to Tracfone, which means this device can only be used on the Tracfone wireless network. A Tracfone plan is required to activate this device. Activating is easy, upon receipt go to Tracfone Website and select ‚ÄúActivate‚Äù and follow the prompts.

Compatible with our no-contract Unlimited Talk & Text plus Data plans starting as low as $20/month plus taxes and fees. To find the Tracfone Plans available to purchase, please go to our TF - Amazon Brand Page linked below the product title.
